settings.title: Seconds Collection
settings.text: Beautiful pottery at accessible prices. These pieces have minor imperfections that don't affect their function but make them more affordable. Perfect for everyday use or as gifts.

settings.title: What Are Seconds?
settings.text: Seconds are pieces with minor imperfections like small glaze drips, slight warping, or color variations. They're still functional and beautiful, just not quite perfect.

settings.title: Same Quality Clay
settings.text: These pieces are made from the same clay and fired at the same temperature as regular pieces. They're just as durable and food-safe.

settings.title: Great Value
settings.text: Seconds are priced 20-40% less than regular pieces, making handmade pottery more accessible while still supporting the artist.

settings.title: Types of Imperfections
settings.text:
Glaze Drips: Small areas where glaze has pooled or dripped during firing
Color Variations: Slight differences from expected glaze color
Minor Warping: Slight irregularities in shape (still functional)
Glaze Skips: Small areas where glaze didn't fully cover
Kiln Marks: Small marks from kiln furniture

All imperfections are clearly noted in each product description with photos.

settings.title: The Beauty of Imperfection
settings.text:
In Japanese aesthetics, there's a concept called wabi-sabi - finding beauty in imperfection. These pieces embody that philosophy, showing the honest character of handmade pottery.

Each 'imperfection' tells a story of the making process and makes each piece even more unique. They're perfect for daily use or as gifts for those who appreciate authentic handmade items.
